Class Checkbox

    public class Checkbox
extends AbstractHTMLElement
implements ElementWithValueConversion<Boolean>
    Element that represents an HTML checkbox.

    Eduardo Ramos

    • Method Detail

      • getValueType

        public Class<?> getValueType()
        Description copied from interface: Element

        Returns the type of the values of this element, to be used when converting values in the form (for example in getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes method). Most element will return String.class Some elements will offer a setValueType method to change the value returned by this.

        If the returned type is null, the element will never by populated by a form, and its values will never be included in extracted form data with methods such as getFormData.

        Specified by:
        getValueType in interface Element
        Overrides:
        getValueType in class AbstractElement
        Returns:
        Value type class or null

      • setValueType

        public void setValueType(Class<?> valueType)
        Description copied from interface: Element

        Changes the value type returned by Element.getValueType() method.

        This type is used in a form to do automatic value conversion in methods such as getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes.

        By default, all elements have String value type.

        This type should only be set to a type which any value set to the element (after validation and filtering) can be converted to.

        Conversion of simple types such as numbers is supported by a form. For any other complex type such as Date, the element can implement the ElementWithValueConversion interface to completely override the conversion of values.

        Not every element supports change of this type. For example, a Checkbox is always Boolean and DatePicker is always Date

        Specified by:
        setValueType in interface Element
        Overrides:
        setValueType in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        valueType - New class for values of the element.

      • setChecked

        public Checkbox setChecked(boolean checked)
        Checks or unchecks this checkbox element.
        Parameters:
        checked - True for checked, false for not checked
        Returns:
        This element

      • isChecked

        public boolean isChecked()
        Indicates if the element is considered checked, that is, the value is the same as the one configured with setEnabledValueString(java.lang.String).
        Returns:
        True if checked, false otherwise

      • setEnabledValueString

        public Checkbox setEnabledValueString(String value)
        Sets the value string considered as checked/enabled. Maintains the checked status considering the current value enabled string.
        Parameters:
        value - Checked value, DEFAULT_ENABLED_VALUE by default
        Returns:
        This element

      • getEnabledValueString

        public String getEnabledValueString()
        Returns the value string considered as checked/enabled.
        Returns:
        Checked value, DEFAULT_ENABLED_VALUE by default

      • getConvertedValue

        public Boolean getConvertedValue()
        Returns the value of this checkbox as a boolean, indicating if the element is checked or not.
        Specified by:
        getConvertedValue in interface ElementWithValueConversion<Boolean>
        Returns:
        True when checked, false otherwise

        public Renderer getDefaultRenderer()
        Description copied from interface: Element

        Returns:
